content: @WG-async-foundations meeting!
this is my first time "attending" a rust meeting, are they purely text-based in zulip?
Project board
@Gus Wynn welcome! and yes, they are
(well, it depends on the group.. a lot of working group meetings are, including this one)

Completed:

  • Potential compiler memory leak in Nightly #75808
Are there any updates to in-progress work?
A quick update on the must_not_await PR, we haven't received any new comments on it.
I think the first draft if ready to be reviewed and I would love some feedback on this.
Thanks, that's something I owe a review on
I'll set aside some time today
Anyone else?
If not, let's move on to triage
The async book PR I've been working on has been approved, just needs to be merged
Sounds good, I'll also take a look today
Uncategorized issues
Unclear diagnostics for async callback that takes a reference #76609
I can agree that this error message is.. not great
I think the code needs an HRTB
What's an HRTB?
sorry, higher-rank trait bound, which looks like for<'a>
another 'not general enough' case, i think we had a tracking issue already.
ah!
an HRTB doesn't actually work in this case, you need to introduce a lifetime param
https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/71671
left a comment
yeah, this may be a duplicate of that issue
( :wave: sorry I'm late)
it's.. a little different, so not sure, but marking as possible duplicate
async fn can't handle multiple lifetimes in a slice of slices #76547
@tmandry your suggestion reminds me this issue https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/68521 not sure they are same or not

tmandry said:

async fn can't handle multiple lifetimes in a slice of slices #76547

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=11988563e3e17db958db369bdd20065d this is confusing for 2 reasons

  1. its not really explaining that an async fn that returns nothing actually returns a future. if I saw this as a new person, id be like "im not returning anything!
  2. its not really explaining the actual lifetime issue or how to fix it

19 | pub async fn readv_at(bufs: &mut [&mut [u8]]) {
   |                                   ---------   -
   |                                   |
   |                                   this parameter and the return type are declared with different lifetimes...
20 |     ListFut(bufs).await
   |             ^^^^ ...but data from `bufs` is returned here
hmm, yeah. so (1) is more async/await-related

https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=d6056d59cffab90e0f5757f475416588 without async it suggests one correction, but when you add it, it errors again it then tells you to add the second 'a which then resolves it
@Gus Wynn agreed on your notes, I think they'd be good to add in a comment on the issue

sounds good, I think it may be valuable to make an A-diagnostic issue to add a note to errors like this explaining that async fn's return Future<Output=[type that the async fn returns] or something like that
yes, I added a couple labels
looks like that's our time for today (and the last issue to triage)
I will say it seems like we have a lot of diagnostics papercuts like this that could use some help.
If anyone is interested in tackling one of these, I'm happy to guide you through the compiler changes needed.
Until next time, thanks for coming everyone :wave:
